chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry C. Pettibone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other probation now serving

miscConds.notes:
The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

Subject to random UA's. 

3 days jail credit, if revoked.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

You must submit to and successfully complete a mental health evaluation to determine appropriate programming commensurate with needs identified.  Must comply with all recommendations.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation. 

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Blank DNA Order
Waive reading of the information.

1:47 PM Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing. Probable cause found.

1:46 PM Defendant Henry C. Pettibone in court.  Attorney Sylvie Dahnert appeared by video for Henry C. Pettibone.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant agrees Judge Becker to sentence Judge Diehns case also. 

22CF70 Enters a plea of Guilty to Count 2. Counts 1 & 3 DRI.   Priors reviewed, accurate. 
21CF171 Count 2 enters a plea of Guilty, repeater. Count 1, enters a plea of Guilty. Counts 3 & 4 DRI. 

Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Ct 2 22CF70 Bail Jumping-Felony contrary to  946.49(1)(b), repeater 939.62(1)(b). 21CF171 Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine contrary to 961.41(3g)(g), repeater 939.62(1)(b), Ct 2 Bail Jumping-Felony contrary to 946.49(1)(b), repeater 939.62(1)(b). 

Joint recommendation: Sentence withheld,  2 years Probation with conditions of risk and needs assessment, follow through with agents recommendations. Defense asking for judgment of bond to be applied to costs. 

Court adopts recommendation: Sentence withheld, orders 2 years probation, conditions of a  risk and needs assessment, follow through with agents recommendations, OADA, mental health eval, random UA's. Prior judgments rescinded, ordered to pay costs of action during probation. 3 days sentence credit in each case, if revoked. 

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Waive reading of the complaint.  PTC set for  and STC set for

Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

Waiver of Prelim on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

Defendant was here earlier, State requested plea rescheduled. No waiver, information, plea questionnaire filed at this time. Judge will confer with JA to see the status.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin. Bond covers 22CF70 and 21CF171.
